title: Prince Harry opens up on trip without Meghan Markle: 'When people from top start ...'
content: Prince Harry urged leaders to listen to youth voices for better impact during his South African visit for his charity Sentebale. Alongside Prince Seeiso, Harry highlighted the charity’s progress and the importance of engaging with young people to create a lasting legacy.
summary: Prince Harry urged leaders to listen to youth voices for better impact during his South African visit for his charity Sentebale. Alongside Prince Seeiso, Harry highlighted the charity’s progress and the importance of engaging with young people to create a lasting legacy.

title: Israel-Hezbollah conflict: How hard liners influence Netanyahu govt
content: Three women were arrested at an Israeli synagogue for advocating a hostage deal, highlighting a perceived crackdown on dissent by Prime Minister Netanyahu's government. National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir, known for tough policies and controversial actions, faces criticism for threatening Israeli democracy. Protests have emerged amid the ongoing conflict with Gaza and tensions with Hezbollah.
summary: Three women were arrested at an Israeli synagogue for advocating a hostage deal, highlighting a perceived crackdown on dissent by Prime Minister Netanyahu's government. National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir, known for tough policies and controversial actions, faces criticism for threatening Israeli democracy. Protests have emerged amid the ongoing conflict with Gaza and tensions with Hezbollah.

title: Bangladesh government recalls 5 envoys, including from India
content: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Muhammad Yunus, has recalled envoys from key international posts, including India and the UN, following significant political upheaval. The recalls follow the resignation and escape of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to India, amid violence claiming over 700 lives.
summary: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Muhammad Yunus, has recalled envoys from key international posts, including India and the UN, following significant political upheaval. The recalls follow the resignation and escape of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to India, amid violence claiming over 700 lives.

title: 'House of horrors': 6-month-old baby almost eaten alive by rats in Indiana; father sentenced to 16 years in prison
content: An Indiana father has been sentenced to over 16 years in prison for severe neglect after his infant son was found with more than 50 rat bites and severe injuries. The mother has taken a plea deal, while the aunt received probation for the incident.
summary: An Indiana father has been sentenced to over 16 years in prison for severe neglect after his infant son was found with more than 50 rat bites and severe injuries. The mother has taken a plea deal, while the aunt received probation for the incident.

title: Trump raises $160 million in Sept as fundraising ahead of election
content: Donald Trump's campaign raised over $160 million in September, boosting his cash reserve to $283 million. Kamala Harris, the Democratic Presidential nominee, outperformed Trump in August with $361 million and recently raised $55 million over a weekend as both parties gear up for a tight race.
summary: Donald Trump's campaign raised over $160 million in September, boosting his cash reserve to $283 million. Kamala Harris, the Democratic Presidential nominee, outperformed Trump in August with $361 million and recently raised $55 million over a weekend as both parties gear up for a tight race.

title: Suspected Marburg virus case in Germany traced back to Africa
content: A medical student and his girlfriend were taken to a specialist clinic for tests after showing flu-like symptoms on a train in Hamburg. They had returned from Rwanda, which is experiencing a Marburg virus outbreak. The station's platform was closed briefly. Marburg virus can cause severe hemorrhagic fever and is highly lethal.
summary: A medical student and his girlfriend were taken to a specialist clinic for tests after showing flu-like symptoms on a train in Hamburg. They had returned from Rwanda, which is experiencing a Marburg virus outbreak. The station's platform was closed briefly. Marburg virus can cause severe hemorrhagic fever and is highly lethal.

title: 'Was screaming, hitting him': 5-year-old Florida boy suffers cardiac arrest on Disney rollercoaster ride
content: Five-year-old Ernesto Tagle encountered a life-threatening situation on Disney's Guardians of the Galaxy ride when he stopped breathing due to a rare heart disorder (CPVT). His mother and passersby administered CPR and used an AED, eventually saving his life. Ernesto is now recovering well with a new heart device.
summary: Five-year-old Ernesto Tagle encountered a life-threatening situation on Disney's Guardians of the Galaxy ride when he stopped breathing due to a rare heart disorder (CPVT). His mother and passersby administered CPR and used an AED, eventually saving his life. Ernesto is now recovering well with a new heart device.

title: Filing details evidence against 'desperate' Trump after 2020 election results
content: A federal judge has unsealed a 165-page document detailing Special Counsel Jack Smith's case against Donald Trump for allegedly trying to overturn the 2020 election results. The filing outlines Trump's attempts to pressure Mike Pence and spread misinformation via social media, leading up to the January 6 Capitol insurrection. Trump denies all allegations.
summary: A federal judge has unsealed a 165-page document detailing Special Counsel Jack Smith's case against Donald Trump for allegedly trying to overturn the 2020 election results. The filing outlines Trump's attempts to pressure Mike Pence and spread misinformation via social media, leading up to the January 6 Capitol insurrection. Trump denies all allegations.

title: 'Have a right to respond but ...': What Biden said on Israel's retaliatory action after Iran's missile attack
content: The US advises Israel to respond cautiously to Iran's missile aggression, urging a proportionate reaction and warning against striking Tehran's nuclear sites. US President Joe Biden and G7 leaders support Israel's right to respond but seek to avoid escalating regional conflict. Meanwhile, Israel's recent airstrike in Beirut has heightened tensions with Hezbollah.
summary: The US advises Israel to respond cautiously to Iran's missile aggression, urging a proportionate reaction and warning against striking Tehran's nuclear sites. US President Joe Biden and G7 leaders support Israel's right to respond but seek to avoid escalating regional conflict. Meanwhile, Israel's recent airstrike in Beirut has heightened tensions with Hezbollah.

title: 'It’s Kam-a-la Harris': CNN anchor gets into heated argument with Trump aide after repeated mispronunciation
content: CNN anchor Jim Acosta cut short an interview with Corey Lewandowski after he repeatedly mispronounced Vice President Kamala Harris’ name despite being corrected. The discussion grew heated over various contentious issues including the 2020 presidential election and immigration, leading Acosta to end the exchange abruptly when Lewandowski refused to comply.
summary: CNN anchor Jim Acosta cut short an interview with Corey Lewandowski after he repeatedly mispronounced Vice President Kamala Harris’ name despite being corrected. The discussion grew heated over various contentious issues including the 2020 presidential election and immigration, leading Acosta to end the exchange abruptly when Lewandowski refused to comply.

title: ‘Slick talker’ vs ‘school shooter’ gaffe: Walz, Vance trade barbs after policy-focused debate
content: Tim Walz and JD Vance engaged in a heated exchange post-debate despite a policy-focused discussion during the vice presidential debate. Vance avoided addressing the 2020 election results, prompting criticism from Walz, who accused Vance of making false claims. Vance focused on attacking Harris for inflation and mocked Walz’s comments on school shooters.
summary: Tim Walz and JD Vance engaged in a heated exchange post-debate despite a policy-focused discussion during the vice presidential debate. Vance avoided addressing the 2020 election results, prompting criticism from Walz, who accused Vance of making false claims. Vance focused on attacking Harris for inflation and mocked Walz’s comments on school shooters.

title: Multiple women from anti-vax group allege romantic ties with RFK Jr after Nuzzi scandal
content: Three women have alleged romantic relationships with Robert F Kennedy Jr, connected through Children’s Health Defense. Allegations follow an emotional affair with a younger reporter. Kennedy denies the claims. Friends of his wife, Cheryl Hines, suggest she may file for divorce. Allegations could impact Donald Trump's presidential campaign, which Kennedy endorsed.
summary: Three women have alleged romantic relationships with Robert F Kennedy Jr, connected through Children’s Health Defense. Allegations follow an emotional affair with a younger reporter. Kennedy denies the claims. Friends of his wife, Cheryl Hines, suggest she may file for divorce. Allegations could impact Donald Trump's presidential campaign, which Kennedy endorsed.

title: Doctor pleads guilty in 'Friends' star Matthew Perry's drug overdose death
content: San Diego doctor Mark Chavez pleads guilty to distributing ketamine to Matthew Perry, contributing to the actor’s fatal overdose. Chavez agrees to cooperate with authorities targeting Dr Salvador Plasencia and dealer Jasmine Sangha, alleged key figures in the illegal drug distribution network.
summary: San Diego doctor Mark Chavez pleads guilty to distributing ketamine to Matthew Perry, contributing to the actor’s fatal overdose. Chavez agrees to cooperate with authorities targeting Dr Salvador Plasencia and dealer Jasmine Sangha, alleged key figures in the illegal drug distribution network.

title: How Russians serve the state: In battle, and in childbirth
content: The Kremlin is pushing men to join the army and women to have more children, offering increased sign-up bonuses and financial rewards. Facing a high casualty rate in Ukraine and a declining birthrate, Russia aims to bolster its military and population.
summary: The Kremlin is pushing men to join the army and women to have more children, offering increased sign-up bonuses and financial rewards. Facing a high casualty rate in Ukraine and a declining birthrate, Russia aims to bolster its military and population.

title: Prisoner charged after punching therapy dog 'Josie' in Genesee County jail
content: An inmate at Genesee County jail allegedly punched a therapy dog named Josie, resulting in a concussion and scrapes. Sheriff Chris Swanson revealed surveillance footage of the incident during a news conference. The suspect, Romello Maxwell, has been charged with aggravated assault, which could lead to a maximum penalty of eight years due to his habitual offender status.
summary: An inmate at Genesee County jail allegedly punched a therapy dog named Josie, resulting in a concussion and scrapes. Sheriff Chris Swanson revealed surveillance footage of the incident during a news conference. The suspect, Romello Maxwell, has been charged with aggravated assault, which could lead to a maximum penalty of eight years due to his habitual offender status.

title: 'Details don't...': Judge unseals filing detailing Trump’s attempts to overturn 2020 election
content: Judge Tanya Chutkan unsealed parts of a filing arguing that former President Trump is not protected by presidential immunity in the effort to overturn the 2020 election. Special Counsel Jack Smith asserts that Trump’s actions were personal, not official. The brief includes key findings, such as Trump’s disregard for Pence’s safety and dismissive reactions to legal advice.
summary: Judge Tanya Chutkan unsealed parts of a filing arguing that former President Trump is not protected by presidential immunity in the effort to overturn the 2020 election. Special Counsel Jack Smith asserts that Trump’s actions were personal, not official. The brief includes key findings, such as Trump’s disregard for Pence’s safety and dismissive reactions to legal advice.

title: 8 Israeli soldiers die in Lebanon as fears of regional war rise
content: Iran launched over 180 missiles at Israel, leading to the death of eight Israeli soldiers in Lebanon. Hezbollah claimed the destruction of three Israeli tanks. Israel's PM Netanyahu vowed resistance against Iran. The UN Security Council called an emergency meeting, while G7 leaders urged diplomacy. US President Biden announced upcoming sanctions on Iran.
summary: Iran launched over 180 missiles at Israel, leading to the death of eight Israeli soldiers in Lebanon. Hezbollah claimed the destruction of three Israeli tanks. Israel's PM Netanyahu vowed resistance against Iran. The UN Security Council called an emergency meeting, while G7 leaders urged diplomacy. US President Biden announced upcoming sanctions on Iran.

title: Former White House aide slams JD Vance for 'straight up lying' about Trump’s stance on Obamacare
content: Former White House aide Alyssa Farah Griffin accused senator JD Vance of lying about Donald Trump’s stance on Obamacare during a discussion on The View. She refuted Vance’s claim that Trump tried to save Obamacare, citing her firsthand experience of their repeal efforts. Griffin also acknowledged Vance’s strong performance in a debate but criticized his honesty.
summary: Former White House aide Alyssa Farah Griffin accused senator JD Vance of lying about Donald Trump’s stance on Obamacare during a discussion on The View. She refuted Vance’s claim that Trump tried to save Obamacare, citing her firsthand experience of their repeal efforts. Griffin also acknowledged Vance’s strong performance in a debate but criticized his honesty.

title: Walz reveals teenage son witnessed St Paul shooting, senator Vance responds with sympathy
content: Minnesota governor Tim Walz shared during a debate that his son, Gus, witnessed a traumatic shooting at a St Paul community center. Gus, praised for his composure, helped keep others safe. The shooter was sentenced to 10 years in prison. Walz’s revelation drew sympathy from Senator JD Vance.
summary: Minnesota governor Tim Walz shared during a debate that his son, Gus, witnessed a traumatic shooting at a St Paul community center. Gus, praised for his composure, helped keep others safe. The shooter was sentenced to 10 years in prison. Walz’s revelation drew sympathy from Senator JD Vance.

title: Trump mocks Jimmy Carter on his 100th birthday, says Biden replaced him as 'worst president'
content: Donald Trump criticised President Joe Biden by comparing him to Jimmy Carter as the "worst president" during a campaign stop. Coinciding with Carter's 100th birthday, Georgia Governor Brian Kemp declared October 1 as “Jimmy Carter Day,” praising Carter's humanitarian contributions despite Trump's remarks.
summary: Donald Trump criticised President Joe Biden by comparing him to Jimmy Carter as the "worst president" during a campaign stop. Coinciding with Carter's 100th birthday, Georgia Governor Brian Kemp declared October 1 as “Jimmy Carter Day,” praising Carter's humanitarian contributions despite Trump's remarks.
